intro: Synostemon lissocarpus, commonly known as the smooth fruit synostemon, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, while the fruits are capsule-like and contain several seeds. Synostemon lissocarpus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and along stream banks.
